content.description:
Upper Class is an extension of

The Classroom

. This is a short, steep wall with big holds 10 feet right of the anchors of

The Classroom

.
content.location:
Essentially this is a 2nd pitch (or continuation) of

The Classroom

Class.

content.description:
A hard move is encountered at the 2nd & 3rd bolt. Continue up, and join

Upper Class

at the last bolt.
content.protection:
6 bolts to 2-bolt anchor shared with

Upper Class

.
content.location:
Scramble up to a black alcove right of and 2/3 of way up

The Classroom

.

content.description: Rhino Beetle has easy climbing on good rock.
content.protection: 9 bolts to anchors at Sun Tan Ledge.
content.location:
Climb just left of the juniper tree, avoiding the big, loose blocks of

Kruger

.

content.description: Although very short, it may have the best climbing moves (briefly) of the Little Five routes.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor with chains.
content.location:
It is best to begin on the dirt ledge left of the 2nd bolt of

Elephant Shrew

.

climbs.name: Mini-Plush Lop
climbs.fa: Grandpa Greg & The Seeley Grandkids (Natalie, Connor, Lauren), 6/10/2020

content.description: This makes for a convenient direct approach to the left side of the Big Five routes. It is named for the rabbits my daughter raises.
content.protection:
4 bolts to the belay anchor for

Harvey

.
content.location: It is left of all the other Little Five routes up the gully.

content.description: This is a great introduction to easy climbing. It has the easiest climbing access to Sun Tan Ledge.
content.protection: 8 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor with chains on the right.
content.location:
Start 20 feet right of

Buffalo Weaver

.

content.description: The FA was done with 4 pieces of gear by a 57-year old man with a torn A1 finger tendon in 39 degree weather wearing tennis shoes and leather gloves.
content.location:
Start between

Leopard Tortoise

and

Rhino Beetle

where the large broken blocks are.

content.description:
Begin as with

Elephant Shrew

, but climb the overhang 6 feet right of the 2nd bolt on

Elephant Shrew

and up the blank face joining

Buffalo Weaver

higher up.
content.protection:
6 bolts. Use first bolt of

Elephant Shrew

and last 2 bolts of

Buffalo Weaver

.
content.location:
It starts on

Elephant Shrew

and finishes on

Buffalo Weaver

.

content.description: Climb over a dead tree and through a small, black roof.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: On the left side, climb through the black rock above the overhang.

content.description: The Classroom is an awesome, little warm-up climb to the far right of the Little Five. It is a great first lead climb.
content.location:
This is the route to the right of

Ant Lion

.

content.protection: 5 bolts to anchors on Sun Tan Ledge.
content.location:
It is just right of

Elephant Shrew

.

content.description: This is the hardest of the Little Five routes. You may have to pause at one point. It is a great introduction to easy slab climbing.
content.protection: Bolts to a 2-bolt anchor with chains on the right side of Sun Tan Ledge.
content.location: It starts on the right of the juniper tree.

climbs.name: A Family Affair
climbs.fa: Erika, Natalie, Connor, Lauren Seeley, & Grampa Greg, 11/24/2019

content.description:
A Family Affair is a fine route marred only by big holds and some easy climbing.

This was bolted for my grandchildren to do their first leads on a first ascent.
content.protection: 7 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor with chains. Anchors have been moved higher and slightly left.
content.location:
It is 30 feet left of

Pumbaa

.
